verses.kjv: There were present at that season some that told him of the Galilaeans, whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
verses.web: Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
verses.ct: Around that time, some people told Jesus about a group of Galileans whom Pilate had killed while they were offering sacrifices — their own blood mixed with the blood of their offerings.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galilaeans were sinners above all the Galilaeans, because they suffered such things?
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Do you think those Galileans were worse sinners than everyone else in Galilee just because this happened to them?

verses.kjv: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.web: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.
verses.ct: Not at all. But I'm telling you, unless you repent, every one of you will perish the same way.

verses.kjv: Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, and slew them, think ye that they were sinners above all men that dwelt in Jerusalem?
verses.web: Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them; do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?
verses.ct: And what about the 18 people who died when the tower in Siloam collapsed on them? Do you think they were guiltier than everyone else living in Jerusalem?

verses.kjv: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.
verses.web: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.”
verses.ct: Not at all. But I'm telling you, unless you repent, every one of you will perish the same way."

verses.kjv: He spake also this parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.
verses.web: He spoke this parable. “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.
verses.ct: Then he told them this parable: "A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard. He went to check it for fruit but didn't find any.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto the dresser of his vineyard, Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?
verses.web: He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?’
verses.ct: So he told the gardener, 'Look, I've come looking for fruit on this fig tree for 3 years now and haven't found a single piece. Cut it down — why should it take up space in the soil?'

verses.kjv: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dung it:
verses.web: He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it and fertilize it.
verses.ct: The gardener replied, 'Sir, give it one more year. Let me dig around it and add fertilizer.

verses.kjv: And if it bear fruit, well: and if not, then after that thou shalt cut it down.
verses.web: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’ ”
verses.ct: If it produces fruit next year, great. But if not, then you can cut it down.'"

verses.kjv: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.
verses.web: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
verses.ct: One Sabbath day, Jesus was teaching in a synagogue.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was a woman which had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and was bowed together, and could in no wise lift up herself.
verses.web: Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years. She was bent over, and could in no way straighten herself up.
verses.ct: A woman was there who had been crippled by an evil spirit for 18 years. She was hunched over and completely unable to stand up straight.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus saw her, he called her to him, and said unto her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.
verses.web: When Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her, “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”
verses.ct: When Jesus noticed her, he called her over and said, "Woman, you are set free from your condition."

verses.kjv: And he laid his hands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.
verses.web: He laid his hands on her, and immediately she stood up straight and glorified God.
verses.ct: He placed his hands on her, and instantly she straightened up and began praising God.

verses.kjv: And the ruler of the synagogue answered with indignation, because that Jesus had healed on the sabbath day, and said unto the people, There are six days in which men ought to work: in them therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.
verses.web: The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude, “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”
verses.ct: But the synagogue leader was furious that Jesus had healed someone on the Sabbath. He turned to the crowd and said, "There are 6 days for work. Come and get healed on one of those days — not on the Sabbath!"

verses.kjv: The Lord then answered him, and said, Thou hypocrite, doth not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the stall, and lead him away to watering?
verses.web: Therefore the Lord answered him, “You hypocrites! Doesn’t each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?
verses.ct: The Lord fired back, "You hypocrites! Every one of you unties your ox or donkey from its stall on the Sabbath and leads it out to get water.

verses.kjv: And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?
verses.web: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”
verses.ct: So why shouldn't this woman — a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept bound for 18 long years — be set free from her chains on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: And when he had said these things, all his adversaries were ashamed: and all the people rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.web: As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
verses.ct: His response put all his critics to shame, while the rest of the crowd celebrated the incredible things he was doing.

verses.kjv: Then said he, Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?
verses.web: He said, “What is God’s Kingdom like? To what shall I compare it?
verses.ct: Then Jesus asked, "What is the kingdom of God like? What can I compare it to?

verses.kjv: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and cast into his garden; and it grew, and waxed a great tree; and the fowls of the air lodged in the branches of it.
verses.web: It is like a grain of mustard seed which a man took and put in his own garden. It grew and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky live in its branches.”
verses.ct: It's like a mustard seed that a man planted in his garden. It grew and became a large tree, and birds came and nested in its branches."

verses.kjv: And again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?
verses.web: Again he said, “To what shall I compare God’s Kingdom?
verses.ct: He continued, "What else can I compare the kingdom of God to?

verses.kjv: It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal, till the whole was leavened.
verses.web: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”
verses.ct: It's like yeast that a woman mixed into 3 measures of flour. Eventually, the yeast worked its way through the entire batch of dough."

verses.kjv: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
verses.web: He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Jesus continued traveling through towns and villages, teaching as he made his way toward Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then said one unto him, Lord, are there few that be saved? And he said unto them,
verses.web: One said to him, “Lord, are they few who are saved?” He said to them,
verses.ct: Someone asked him, "Lord, will only a few people be saved?" He answered them,

verses.kjv: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
verses.web: “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in and will not be able.
verses.ct: "Fight to get through the narrow door, because many people will try to enter and won't be able to.

verses.kjv: When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:
verses.web: When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don’t know you or where you come from.’
verses.ct: Once the master of the house gets up and locks the door, you'll be left standing outside knocking and calling, 'Lord, Lord, open up for us!' But he'll answer, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'

verses.kjv: Then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets.
verses.web: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’
verses.ct: Then you'll protest, 'But we ate and drank with you! You taught in our streets!'

verses.kjv: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity.
verses.web: He will say, ‘I tell you, I don’t know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’
verses.ct: And he'll reply, 'I'm telling you, I don't know where you come from. Get away from me, all of you who practice evil.'

verses.kjv: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.
verses.web: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets in God’s Kingdom, and yourselves being thrown outside.
verses.ct: You'll weep and grind your teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets inside the kingdom of God — while you yourselves are thrown out.

verses.kjv: And they shall come from the east, and from the west, and from the north, and from the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.
verses.web: They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in God’s Kingdom.
verses.ct: People will come from east and west, from north and south, and take their places at the table in the kingdom of God.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.
verses.web: Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.”
verses.ct: Pay attention: some who are last will end up first, and some who are first will end up last."

verses.kjv: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.
verses.web: On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him, “Get out of here, and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.”
verses.ct: That same day, some Pharisees came to Jesus and warned him, "You need to leave this area — Herod wants to kill you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.
verses.web: He said to them, “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Go tell that fox, 'Look, I'm driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow, and on the 3rd day I will finish my work.'

verses.kjv: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
verses.web: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can’t be that a prophet would perish outside of Jerusalem.’
verses.ct: But I must keep moving today, tomorrow, and the next day — because no prophet can die outside of Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and ye would not!
verses.web: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!
verses.ct: "Jerusalem, Jerusalem — you murder the prophets and stone the messengers God sends to you! How many times I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, but you refused!

verses.kjv: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until the time come when ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
verses.web: Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’ ”
verses.ct: Look, your house is abandoned and desolate. I tell you, you won't see me again until the day comes when you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!'"
